website_summaries.verdict: The price is right, but Immedia's Blink just doesn't offer enough functionality when you factor in the competition.
pros: You can install Immedia's battery-powered Blink anywhere (inside your house)
One camera -- and its requisite Sync Module accessory -- cost less than $100
cons: Blink doesn't currently support two-way talk, audio alerts, third-party integrations, on-demand recording, local storage, arm/disarm scheduling, in-app rules or other common features

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you have Smartthings..
customer_reviews.text: I've already contacted CS with Blink to see about getting a RMA number to return. I cannot believe they would without notice stop my services from working and yes, I am talking about the Smartthings work around for integration. VERY DISAPPOINTED...
customer_reviews.author: flexntj

customer_reviews.title: No Smartthings integration
customer_reviews.text: I only bought this camera because of the available Smartthings integration. Today I got an email from the Blink team saying that they will no longer support Smartthings integration (including the RBoy app) If you have a Smartthings hub do yourself a favor and buy an Arlo camera instead.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Dropped SmartThings integration, lost all value to me.
customer_reviews.text: They just pulled smart things integration without warning. This product is now useless to me. Fortunately I'm still within my return period, because these are definitely going back. If you don't care about smart things integration, then these are alright, but honestly their software is pretty garbage, so you might consider ponying up for the arlo cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for security because I was going overseas for a long trip. While I was away my place was broken into. I did not receive a notification. When I returned I saw an email from Blink saying their servers went down and that a physical hard reset would be needed to turn it back up. This is not possible when you are not physically home. If they have a system issue the camera should be able to reset itself afterwards. Because of this the intruder was not caught on camera. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Crystal clear video of people stealing your stuff.
customer_reviews.text: My home was just burglarized about 2 hours ago and luckily with these cameras I got the motion alert as soon as they came through the door. I was able to call the police and to watch in real time as the stole everything but could give descriptions over the phone. The police were impressed with the clarity of the video. They were in and out in just a few minutes so the police didn't make a it in time. It they were pretty certain with that video they could get them. We thought for awhile it was an expensive cat cam, but hopefully it helps the investigation.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Poor support for a product with limited stand-alone functionality
customer_reviews.text: Previously, I felt these camera deserved a 4-star review. What they're able to do with only 2 double AA batteries is truly impressive. However, today I received an email stating they were pulling support for the Samsung Smartthings home automation system, which is the sole reason I purchased them in the first place. As stand-alone cameras, they leave a lot to be desired: No motion-sensing, so manual video feed, no temperature metrics, can't individually enable or disable cameras, no ability to trigger other actions, etc. These cameras will be listed on eBay shortly. I'd recommend everyone steer-clear of this product and company.
customer_reviews.author: Troy L.

customer_reviews.title: ... with the discontinued support for Smartthings I can not recommend this product if you plan on using it with ...
customer_reviews.text: Well with the discontinued support for Smartthings I can not recommend this product if you plan on using it with Smartthings. Blink is extending their return policy to 12 months if purchased through them, unfortunately purchasers through Amazon are out in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Greg ottria

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!!! They don't last!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you want a system that works continously don't by the blink system. The whole system will disarm itself for hours at a time and then decide to restart at will. We have cameras less than a year old that will no longer connect to wifi with fresh batteries and literally sitting on top of the wifi router and within 10 inches of the synch module. I have 10 cameras and now only 4 work right. The whole system likes to shut down completely intermittently all with no loss of internet or power. This system is not worth the money spent on it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase if you use SmartThings
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to do any home automation or use SmartThings do not purchase this product. With zero notice Blink discontinued support for SmartThings on December 19 which leaves hundreds of users without security and automation. There was no explanation except a cryptic message to change our passwords. This is a company that does not care for their customers and cannot be trusted with security in our homes and businesses.
customer_reviews.author: boxfan

customer_reviews.title: Wish it worked
customer_reviews.text: I read the good reviews here and was motivated to buy this. Maybe its my luck- I got a bad sku shipped. I spent 2 hrs trying to connect this thing- but have failed. Its given me several errors - The product description is promising, but wish it had lived up to my expectations- just work. Its going back.
customer_reviews.author: Jaee P

customer_reviews.title: Dishonest Company
customer_reviews.text: Dishonest company. I bought and recommended this product to countless families due to their touted SmartThings integration. They've, without warning, disabled this integration. The 'free' cloud storage is minimal and won't store enough to catch that thief that you didn't realize robbed you until a day or two later. Battery life is hype, they certainly do not last 2 years simply because PIR sensitivity doesn't work well and cannot be masked or zoned. My batteries last less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: MaYHeM

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these cameras. There are a lot of cons. One really big con is that there is a delay when the recording starts. Often times when I review the camera footage, the person is already on our doorstep. Or when a package is delivered, the camera only picks up the end of the delivery and records the trek back to the truck. I have altered the settings and nothing seems to work. Somewhat disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: No SmartThings = Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: If you can't trust a company that makes security cameras, that is a pretty bad sign. Without any notice, they disabled integration with SmartThings, which they previously supported. Horrible move by Blink, and this makes the cameras nearly functionless.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A.

customer_reviews.title: I bought them purely because of their Smartthings integration. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought them purely because of their Smartthings integration. They cancelled the integration without any notice. This is not fair. Don't buy them
customer_reviews.author: Fab

customer_reviews.title: isn't good. BUT these
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased many home security cameras, usually they're difficult to set up and the quality, when they work, isn't good. BUT these, are amazing cameras!!!! Easy to use and great quality pics. I first purchased 5 for our home then the add on. Easy as can be. Buy it, you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Target lover

customer_reviews.title: Go bankrupt and die Blink
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with my blink cameras for over a year, until today, out of the blue, Blink pulled Smartthings support. Now they're useless to me. It's funny, I was just marvelling at what a great little device this was last night, and considering buying 2 more, then this morning I find an email from blink stating that the Rboy SmartThings integration has been cut off from their API effective immediately, with no other explanation. I now own $200 worth of useless junk. Without the ST integration they're useless to me. Another american company that hates their loyal customers. Run buy a business school grad no doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Bill M.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Half the time I can't view anything and it only lets me view the camera for a few seconds. It's a waste of money. I bought it to check on my dogs but the battery is already dying in it after a few months of use. I should have gone with something else. The motion detection doesn't work. The only good thing about the camera is that it tells the temperature and the camera has a light for night time use.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: App doesn't work with PC and won't work with older cellphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera security system some time ago and it worked fine. However, now the cameras are useless since Blink has decided not to support the app to control the cameras on older android operating systems on smartphones. What this means is that you either have to buy a new cell phone or the cameras are useless. This is clearly unacceptable as my smartphone works fine with all other apps. You cannot control the system via a PC either. I strongly recommend NOT buying anything from this company. And this happened after Amazon bought and took over the company. Shame on you Amazon. I'll consider this when buying anything from you too.
customer_reviews.author: Meticulous

customer_reviews.title: 10 Sec delay Matters!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this security system for several months now & very disappointed after waiting for it’s updated version. Originally I wanted the audio version, however purchased this knowing the audio was forthcoming... now! reviews questionable and I’m hesitant! with this versions problems the temp. Goes wacky (mostly high warnings), batteries definitely don’t last if you’re using blink daily, something to think about... The time it takes to choose & expense is nothing to sweep under the carpet! Biggest malfunction, in my opinion is the delay! I don’t like the 10, delay! one can easily get around that!
customer_reviews.author: Marie Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Wow, I got scammed
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I got scammed. Bought these cameras because of all the great reviews, but as I look more deeply into them I am highly suspect about the validity of these reviews. I have three of these cameras in each of them keep getting knocked off line. Customer support is great but they keep telling me to do the same things over and over again which doesn’t work. I’ve spent hours trying to fix my router settings and replace the batteries over and over again. Same problems keep occurring. There’s no way that this many customers are experiencing five star reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey&Mike

customer_reviews.title: Makes me look fat.
customer_reviews.text: This is a real bargain and works great. Only problem is that when I forget to disarm it when I come home, the video it takes of me entering the front door makes me look fat. Like John Goodman fat.
customer_reviews.author: C. Elkin

customer_reviews.title: 2 yr battery only lasts 2 months.  Don’t believe the hype.
customer_reviews.text: Researched WiFi cameras that for this category for ages. Picked this option because of the promised 2 yr battery life. Here it’s only been two months and I’m replacing batteries already. Camera placed in area to capture normal use.
customer_reviews.author: 2 cents

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE! These are the OLD model - NO TWO-WAY AUDIO
customer_reviews.text: Beware that Amazon is dumping their old model cameras in this bundle. I just bought these and set them up to find out from a tech rep that these are the old model that does not have two-way audio. I am Extremely Disatisfied Customer - that Amazon would not identify these as the OLD MODEL.
customer_reviews.author: ProConsumerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: The camera worked great for a while
customer_reviews.text: The camera worked great for a while. Later, the camera would not connect to the Sync Module. I was in contact with Blink's support via email and tried everything they asked several times to no avail. Several months have passed and I still cannot get the camera to connect with the Sync Module. My most recent email to support has gone unanswered for several days now. I like the system WHEN IT WORKS. I now have two Blink cameras One Blink XT and one Blink) and a Sync Module that do not work at all. I have wasted several hundred dollars on this system. I don't think I would recommend buying these Blink cameras.
customer_reviews.author: J Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Efficient
customer_reviews.text: I love my Blink. I live in a condo and am concerned about people with access coming and going at will (it has happened before). I did a lot of research and was completely confused by my choices, but got some help here from people like you and decided to try Blink (Black Friday sale). I am not tech savvy by any stretch and Blink was simple to install and get up and running. The images are great, there is sound, and it is exactly what I wanted and need. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: 10bac10

customer_reviews.title: Blink is now a worthless paperweight.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! After buying five cameras due to the really good integration with SmartThings, they've now sent out notices to everyone saying "On December 19, 2017, Blink is discontinuing support for all SmartThings integrations including the developer RBoy app. For your security, we recommend that you change your Blink password. We thank for your continued support of Blink and apologize for any inconvenience."
customer_reviews.author: I. Dean

customer_reviews.title: The Best Home Camera I Have Had
customer_reviews.text: I have had 4 home motion detection cameras, and this one is by far the best I have had. The price is fair. If you like the Ring Doorbell you will like the Blink camera. They both work well with Alexa. I have NOT been able to do one test with it yet. Normally cameras send a false alarm when they switch from day vision to night vision. I cannot comment on that aspect. The base station can accommodate 10 cameras. All 10 can be armed or disarmed without effecting the others.
customer_reviews.author: rnaser

customer_reviews.title: Good indoor WiFi Camera.
customer_reviews.text: While these cameras cannot rival the more professional WiFi Cameras, they do perform an adequate job considering the cost. They're relatively inexpensive and durable. I have both indoor and outdoor cameras and they seem to work quite well during the past 12 months.
customer_reviews.author: ELLIOTT G.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad as a a back up
customer_reviews.text: Camera is nice.. field of view nice.... Motion Detection is lacking !!! Either inside or out, there is a significant delay. I have one indoor and one outdoor. The outdoor one is close to the front door. A person can make it to the door and leave and I will only get a blip of them leaving. There is a good 3-4 second delay before they activate. The same with the indoor one. I will use these as backups, but am going to look for another MAIN solution. ps. yes, sensitivity on both is maxed out.
customer_reviews.author: Herzl

customer_reviews.title: Such a great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: At such a low price we were hesitant about the quality of the product but were VERy pleasantly surprised. Clarity of the video is great, there's also a light that turns on at night that is motion sensored which was a bonus to discover. I'm buying add on cameras next! BTW, we use the indoor camera outside. it's mounted up in an awning that is never affected by the elements. The alerts come to your phone within 10-15 seconds (maybe less) of video footage taken.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Bonanzo

customer_reviews.title: No date and time stamp included.
customer_reviews.text: Did NOT like the fact that there's no DATE AND TIME STAMP included on the video. Without them it's not admissible in court. Nice little camera, but it's next to worthless. I will know that my house was broken into and possibly who did it, but won't be able to do anything about it.
customer_reviews.author: ILikeMyWrangler

customer_reviews.title: worked really well for 45 minutes....
customer_reviews.text: They worked for 45 minutes. Now I just get a spinning wheels and "Live update not available" etc..... Website is conveniently down so I cannot get support, Amazon Support guided me through resetting the sync module (delete the module and reinstall, something I cannot do if away from the house) so the whole thing is Going back. Too bad it worked really well for 45 minutes. Should have just turned on cameras and waited a day before installing them all over the house.
customer_reviews.author: DMC...

customer_reviews.title: Will wake up your kids with bright light. No night vision.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kids bedroom. I have kids who don’t sleep through the night and I need to be awakened if they get up. Needless to say, if they turn over or raise their arms or legs, as toddlers can do, it triggers the camera (YES!) but also a bright light that shines right in their eyes (NO!!!!!!) It has no night vision, which I never even thought to check because I have the outdoor version as well as a cheaper indoor camera that actually HAS night vision. It just stopped working after two years and I really liked the Blink outdoor and assumed I’d be happy with the indoor. Needless to say I need to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up but not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I can't give this a good rating. While it's easy enough to set up it's completely and totally unreliable. I constantly get "live camera view failed" messages. I even get "system busy" messages sometimes as well. It's annoying. The whole point of buying this is to be able to view live camera! The wifi strength and the module to camera strength are both the highest bars. They're literally only 15 feet away from each other. I have no idea why it won't work but I will certainly not buy anymore or recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: JeremeyMT

customer_reviews.title: Limited functionality without Smartthings integration.
customer_reviews.text: Was great until they dropped Smartthings integration, out of the blue with no warning. The biggest drawback to the native Blink app is all the cameras are all armed or disarmed, you can't create zones. So for my setup, I'd like the outdoor cameras armed while I'm home, but the indoor cameras disarmed. This can't be setup with the Blink app but Smartthings enabled you to do it.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.text: I use this indoors for my apartment. Last week I was out of town and it filmed several motion clips (my landlord checking the apartment) - very clear picture and sound. The app and camera work great; sometimes it can have trouble picking up motion in complete darkness but the sensitivity can be adjusted in settings. If you need an affordable security camera for inside your home, I highly recommend this product. It looks like most of the negative reviews are from several years ago. I ignored them and bought the camera anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a while and suddenly it's not recording motion. My return window closed 10 days ago. Very unhappy. Went through all my settings and had to manually turn motion detection back on. Why would it be turned off??? How did it turn off??? Did someone hack my system and enter my home??? Motion detection is always always ALWAYS enabled when I arm it. I am a single woman live alone and think the system is worthless for security. I have had a stalker and someone entering my home and have zero confidence in this system. The only thing it IS good for is to take a live shot when you're away to check on your home and pets.
customer_reviews.author: cards&crafts

customer_reviews.title: company discontinued service
customer_reviews.text: Without warning, Blink cut off all integrations (connections to other services) except IFTTT. So if you were expecting to use this as part of a home automation or security system, you’re out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Charles

customer_reviews.title: Clear images, good sensitivity
customer_reviews.text: I use this camera to monitor outside activities through a sash window. The motion sensitivity, Wi-Fi connection, and images are great. I think the images are even better than the outdoor version I got before (the sash net becomes translucent). I like their added “areas to ignore” feature; and that multiple Blink cameras can use a shared hub. Two enhancements I would like: make the light of the illuminator more indirect and spread out for better night vision; make the batteries last longer.
customer_reviews.author: L. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Simply doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Features get a one star rating because the camera doesn't work! Connectivity is 5 bars. Error message says it unexpectedly stopped. Have reset it, uninstalled and re-installed, changed batteries; everything blink says to do and still won't connect. These cameras are relatively expensive compared to others that are available so I would certainly expect them to work. CS has been of no help, telling me to do what I've already done over and over. Unfortunately I've missed the window for returns so it's just decoration and acts as a "dummy camera" now. Would NOT buy again, disappointed with Amazon which is usually great on returns and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: JLB_TX

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting so much more for 113 USD. I bought a nice cam for 32USD that has night vision, bi directional audio and can be access in real time with no lag. I was so frustrated to see that when trying to see the feed from my cameras it has a lag of almost 10 seconds. The rest works fine, but it’s so frustrating being in the same network and have such a lag that I can not give more than 2 stars. I would return it if I could but I got the product on my way to the airport and only got to test it when got home far away.
customer_reviews.author: Ignacio

customer_reviews.title: Second camera.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a second camera for the hallway. I also own the Amazon Cloud Camera. This is just as efficient and was cheaper. A spider was crawling on the lens and we got to witness a horror movie type of alert. Biggest pro is it takes battery vs having to plug in, unlike Amazon’s. We’ve had it since December and as of this review we have no had to change the batteries. The video quality is decent enough for price. Not too grainy. Night mode works awesome. The app is easy to use. No problems what so ever. Five star item! (Bonus that we got it during an Amazon sale and it was bundled with the Echo dot!)
customer_reviews.author: Mamasaurusx3

customer_reviews.title: Eh.  More of a novelty than security
customer_reviews.text: We purchase a set of these to use in our garage. We wanted something inexpensive that we could quickly access when we could not remember if we closed the garage. The battery life was poor. No way do the batteries last 2 years on normal use. We didn't even make it 9 months before we had to purchase new batteries - even with minimal use. WiFi was iffy...the cameras lost connection alot. Other wifi devices nearby did not have any issues (ie - Ring.com). I would not purchase these if I was going to rely on them for security purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera, feel safe with this!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little camera. I was able to angle it where it can see both entrances to my condo. It sends me a message on my phone if it detects motion which gives me a peace of mind while I am at work or on the road. My only fear is that when the wifi isn't on it doesn't record as everything is on the cloud. However, it does it's job and it does it well.. great image quality...
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Vargas

customer_reviews.title: These are garbage
customer_reviews.text: These are absolute garbage. I have had them for about 2 months. Batteries already when dead. In addition, the night vision for these cameras consist of a giant bright light to light up the area. That is not night vision. Lastly, installed a new router, and tried to reconnect these cameras to the new wifi. They won't connect. Tried several times, and honestly I don't have the patience nor the time to sit around for hours trying to get them to work again. They are going in the garbage
customer_reviews.author: soflatechie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought two Blink cameras for indoor purposes. They were very easy to set up with my currently existing outdoor Blink camera. Now I have three blink cameras to monitor home security. Not only is it fun to see what’s happening in other rooms or outside but it gives you a level of security. Once armed you can add a sound alert or just a banner on your iPhone or iPad if you want to know what triggered the camera in that particular room. It syncs with Alexa for live viewing of the area. They work great.
customer_reviews.author: Marti

customer_reviews.title: Customer service with blink is horrible. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Original camera purchased for indoor use and would not work unless it was a few inches from base station. Contacted blink support and was sent another camera after going thru setup 2times for them. Received a BROKEN refurbished camera a few days later, called blink support again and was asked to go thru setup for a third time on original camera. This is the worst customer service that I have ever received. Still haven’t got a properly working new camera. Due to their extremely poor and ignorant customer service, I simply can not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: buyer1

customer_reviews.title: Don’t believe the reviews
customer_reviews.text: Blink was bought by Amazon...so the company is biased. It had a lot of reviews, which is why I decided to try it. Once I set it up, I realized the video quality is awful. There is also a long delay in what actually happened and what the app shows. I suggest spending your money on a different product. Instead of spending just over $200 for three bad quality video cameras that can’t move, I spent $120 on three cameras that are 1080p, and can be moved remotely while I’m at work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need Continuous Feed
customer_reviews.text: I am so tired of having to keep clicking "continue" in order to keep the feed running. Sometimes, I need to tune in for 4-5 minutes at a time (I remotely monitor an elderly parent and his caretaker). The feed cuts off very quickly and there are NO settings to adjust the time. 30 seconds and that's it. Unless you are constantly on top of that "continue" button, you're out of luck. Good camera, good viewing. I like everything about them except for this software issue and, unfortunately, this is a huge issue.
customer_reviews.author: AC12345

customer_reviews.title: No Web or Desktop App - By the time I pull up the phone app, too late...
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a year and a half and while it works well, has nice features, and was easy to set up, it still has no web or desktop application. If you want to see something, you have to pull out your phone and pull up the app. I was trying to use this to see who was at my front door without having to get up from my desk, but by the time I got the app on my phone up, whoever it was is gone too often. I've decided to finally give up on waiting and go with a camera that has some kind of web or desktop application.
customer_reviews.author: rsvp

customer_reviews.title: Eats through batteries. 2yr battery life is laughable!!
customer_reviews.text: The 2 year battery life is absolutely hilarious! Lucky if it lasts 2 months! It also often gives me a notice that it can’t connect Blink console thingy to the WiFi or that it can’t connect to the camera... yet they are literally right next to each other! 700sq ft apartment and it often has trouble connecting everything together and blink goes offline? WHATS THE POINT OF HAVING A SECURITY SYSTEM THAT DOES THAT?! So annoying. Oh and did I mention it eats through batteries?! UGH! Wish I would’ve gone with a different brand/company.
customer_reviews.author: ART

customer_reviews.title: This worked in testing at my house. I installed ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked in testing at my house. I installed it more than 2,000 miles away in a special area and flew home. The sync module is now offline even though the power is on. Because of the situation I'm not able to have anyone access it to do any problem solving.
customer_reviews.author: ConcreteGuy

customer_reviews.title: Night Vision Not Good
customer_reviews.text: For the money, these are great. If you need crystal clear pictures/movies during the night there are better options. They do have a light but arming that will tell the intruder they are being filmed. So the intruder will probably pick it up and put it in his sac with everything else they steal from you. Without the light the night vision is worse than poor. It's a trade-off though because one with good night vision will be much more expensive. Price is right for me though.
customer_reviews.author: DK072257

customer_reviews.title: Works for my purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, easy setup. Only wish that when you check live stream the blue light comes on...very noticeable if trying to be discrete. I tried to disguise it and cover the light. But If I do, then the motion sensor is blocked and won;t notify me if there is motion. Overall, it serves my purpose but wish the blue light would be discrete​.
customer_reviews.author: Gianyna2220

customer_reviews.title: Call rather than email
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues with fire wall but called tech support rather than email and the lovely lady in the Philippines was very patient and we got it sorted out. Do not use email to contact them because it won't get answered. Use the number in the Blink app and call them directly.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Pochatko

customer_reviews.title: Great for Teens!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a home camera system because I’m a working single mom and my teen isn’t at the age where they need a sitter anymore. However TEENS can’t be trusted! I love these cameras. They work perfect. They’re easy to install and gives me peace of mind. I can work and know my kiddo is safe at home and not doing something they shouldn’t be. Plus, monitoring is 100% free! Works perfect with the WiFi. I had a small issue initially where it wouldn’t pick up the signal but it was an easy fix. Just turn off camera system and WiFi system. once it’s reset it’ll all link together!
customer_reviews.author: RANNY

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and operation, visible light illumination cameras
customer_reviews.text: Decided I needed a security system for use during the rare occasions that I travel. Decided on the Blink system after watching many reviews. The Blink system had everything I was looking for at a price that was attractive. Bought the XL cameras for outside and the standard for indoor. I setup two systems one for inside cameras and one for outside cameras. This way I can disable inside camera when we are at home while still protecting the outside. One thing I don’t like about the indoor cameras is the illumination is visible light, had I have known that I would have spent a few more dollars and purchased another outdoor kit instead of the indoor cameras and kits.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Failed almost exactly 1 year after purchase, but a replacement was shipped quickly
customer_reviews.text: The camera failed exactly 366 days - one year + one day - after my purchase. The camera is basically a brick now - can't connect to wifi, no settings, no troubleshooting guides online, no reset button. I've contacted tech support and will update the review if I can get the unit back online. Until then, this is trash. Even a cheap camera should last more than 1 year. edit: after walking through a couple troubleshooting steps with tech support to confirm product failure, i got a replacement within a few days. still not great that it failed so quickly, but happy to have a new working unit.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B

customer_reviews.title: No motion detection through glass.
customer_reviews.text: I found out from a forum that the motion detection does not work if you place the camera behind a window. There is no mention of this in the setup directions. I set the cameras up went outside walking back and forth waving my hands and there was no image. I went back inside and waved my hand in front of the camera and it worked. This product shouldn't even be called a security camera it is just a baby monitor. I want to see a burglar before they break into my house not when they are already inside. I am returning the cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: It's a yes sis
customer_reviews.text: Got this with me had a babysitter back at the beginning of the year and I would say that I really do love using this item I think it makes being able to make sure everything is okay in your home and really give you that sense of security that as a mother you may be wanting or parent in general absolutely love it and for the price you really can't be the quality of the picture as well as there is a live mode so you can actually see what things are happening not just random pictures within a file
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana Alphonso

customer_reviews.title: Indoor camera flashes the intruder
customer_reviews.text: In the night, this camera will turn on a light when triggered, which is handy if you want to alert the intruder (or you) that recording is happening. It is also kind of handy as a light for that effect. The wifi signal sometimes has problems updating the display picture and also live view (which may have more to do with the system rather than the individual camera). The customer support though was very helpful for sending a replacement for another one of these that failed to sync.
customer_reviews.author: John Longmire

customer_reviews.title: 👀
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good camera especially when operating off a battery. Bought this in Nov and it’s now July, I am now needing to replace the AA battery it came with. That’s with not recording / motion detection off / disarmed. Use it to keep an eye on the dogs when we are away from the house. Not sure how long it would last while recording. Video Quality good. Audio quality good. Access/set up easy. Noticed it was having trouble connecting recently but I’m pretty sure it’s because of the battery. I plugged in the USB and it was quick to connect. Like the system, recently bought the X2 and mini to add.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Good for teenagers.
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought one when we were going on vacation and for the first time, my son wasn't coming with us because he was old enough to stay on his own. We had rules in place and he had agreed to them. The very first day, rule broken. We called and questioned him. He was totally confused because he didn't know about the camera. Since then, we've bought more. My husband loves these things!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Dubois

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stay synched to module
customer_reviews.text: Worst I’ve ever bought! Bought the three camera system but it only allows one camera on. Constantly telling me the module is offline. I have the module two feet from my WiFi modem. And the cameras in the same room. I’ve tried deleting it all and reinstalling, I’ve tried changing the batteries,which do not last long at all. I’ve tried so many things I’m ready to throw it all out the window. On a positive note when the one camera is connected it does a good job. But this is not worth all the frustration and money I spent for three camerasand only one is allowed to sync with the module!
customer_reviews.author: Rare Books

customer_reviews.title: A Great Camera System
customer_reviews.text: We bought a set of the Blink cameras when we moved into an area that was experiencing a string of break-ins. It works so well, we've purchased 2 more for our new place since we moved away from that area. We like that we can select which cameras are on & off, adjust the motion sensitivity, the re-trigger time, & the clip length from our phones. The only thing I don't love is that if you select the live video feed, it doesn't record what's happening.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: Did not workout for me at all.
customer_reviews.text: Most dissatisfied purchase of 2018 (comparing to all my purchases). Why on Earth would you have BRIGHT flashlight turned ON to see in the dark? Why not IR? What is this, 1999? WTF!!! Retuning to Amazon! BAD *Very slow video. Lags at least 30 seconds. *Bright light turns on in the dark. This can't be good for the battery. *Motion sensors did not kick in many times. GOOD *Easy setup *Cheap If any intruders get in your house, and the flashlight turns on, they might get blinded and sue you! *****EDIT****** Try the BlinkXT... That's better. I bought that, it's much better. Not best, but much better.
customer_reviews.author: Akbar777

customer_reviews.title: Good cameras for the price
customer_reviews.text: We've had these to keep an eye on our dogs when we are not home. We have a few of the outdoor night vision and the regular ones. Cameras have always worked well. Batteries have been installed for a year with no problems. The only downside is the fact you can only view one camera at a time. The new cameras have the talk option on them which ours do not have. If you have good WiFi you should have no issues. Our home is about 2,500 square feet with 2 floors and a detached guest house which picks up the sync module as well.
customer_reviews.author: LinkE

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, monitor your property from anywhere
customer_reviews.text: Very impressive home security, it helps me to monitor the house while I'm gone via the app. Easy to set up, place anywhere you wanted, I had one mounted and one I switch places periodically. Video quality is acceptable but during the night life when the LED turns on, some areas are over exposed. But overall, it's a nice piece(s) to have if you are away from home often. Sometimes I even check the real time video to see if I turn off the lights, or what my dog is doing.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sun

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your $ on these.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these cameras a few months ago and installed them in my home. The picture quality of good, but there is at least a few p second delay in the live feed. The cameras also light up blue when you view the live feed, making it very obvious you are watching. There is no way to turn the light off either. The sound is just ok, and after two months of use the motion detection feature stopped working in all cameras. Very disappointing. I would not recommend these and I would not purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: BAJ

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: Product packaging is great...but it ends there. The instructions are kind of guessy - and you need to be within spitting distance of your WiFi to attach. The Blink app has a link called "Help" in it, but when you click it, you get a 404. Some of the instructions say to go back to spot X to start over, but that is not the right place. Not a good experience.
customer_reviews.author: Stonewall Krantz

customer_reviews.title: Easy, simple, reliable!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS! The motion detection is top notch and the voice quality is great also. I wish there was two way audio so I could reply back but it’s great if you’re just watching in on your house sitter, kids during the day, who stops by your porch etc. I’ve had it for a few months and had NO issues. Easy step by step set up, small and out of the way too!
customer_reviews.author: Mikaylah

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Having fun with this. I can look in on my home anytime, which is reassuring in this day and age. Slight learning curve when adjusting settings to your preference. It also can detect temperature swings (too high, too low) which is another big plus to this inexpensive system!! May get an outdoor add-on camera next!!! Easy to set up and very good quality pics and video for what it is. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. MCMULLIN

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. Clean clear and crisp pictures and videos. Sound is very good. I am happy!
customer_reviews.text: Cameras work as advertised. Videos are crisp and clear and easy to hear. The cameras themselves are quite small, not a large footprint, and would be hard for someone to notice. Originally, on the two cameras I ordered, the motion detector on one camera did not work. I contacted Blink and tried several things they suggested to get the motion detector to work but to no avail. Blink sent a replacement camera and a return packing slip and label. The replacement camera worked just fine including the motion detector. I am very happy with this purchase and might order an "outside" camera to go with my two indoor cameras. Very good cameras and very good customer service from Blink.
customer_reviews.author: DubbyJ

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: !st, the screen is so small and picture is not very clear. So I decided to return. When I put the order in, I requested the refund to go back to the same card I used to purchase. Instead they issued a gift card refund. I kept looking for a refund for over 2 weeks now and finally realized the "gift card" was supposedly used to pay for other purchases. Caused a major confusion on billing.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: be aware buyers
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased a set of this product and wanted to add another camera to another place in my house, but unfortunately I did not notice that it was not possible to add Camera from different regions, It means that if you bought the module System with the camera from Amazon US, you cannot add a Camera that you buy from Amazon UK, you won't be able to add it, it won't work.
customer_reviews.author: ALI

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Here's what I like. Battery lasts. I'm into two years on three of the cameras I've bought. I now own 5 cameras for various uses. 1. Summer home exterior and interior monitoring. 2. My Mom in an assisted living scenario making sure she's taken care of and 3. my home front door. Nothing but positive here with only one wish. I wish it allowed for two way audio and faster notifications as there's enough of a delay that the person who activated the camera is often no longer there.
customer_reviews.author: James Ward

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is not two years and broke easily!
customer_reviews.text: I hope Blink has improved their product since I purchased it in 2018. One of the cameras was not operational when it arrived and the company sent a replacement. I had a lot of issues with the batteries. Maybe the battery life lasts two years if it doesn't have to do any recording, but I had to change the batteries a half a dozen times over 1 year. The first time I called the company they sent replacement batteries. Also the cameras broke easily when they get knocked over and since the base is not sturdy at all it is a likely scenario. I don't usually write negative reviews but can not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Field

customer_reviews.title: Simple to connect and operate
customer_reviews.text: Once you have a system set up, adding another camera to it is a breeze. It suffers from the same problems as the outdoor camera (intermittent motion detection, low quality in low light), so choose its application with those (and other reported flaws) in mind. If you need a SECURITY system, I recommend looking elsewhere. This is just a toy, really.
customer_reviews.author: Old Timer

customer_reviews.title: low battery life
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in the battery life. I have had for less than a year and have to change the batteries already. My office is closed 4 days a week and that is when the camera is set for on. When my office is open I turn it off as there is no need for the camera when people are in the office. The only time the camera goes off is when the cleaners are there once a week for approx 10 minutes. Other times the camera is idle.
customer_reviews.author: idahoemt

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Using an indoor cam outside for the porch although I know it is not recommended. It sits safely under an overhang and is not exposed to temps outside of the recommended range. So far it tracks motion well and I have had no issues with connectivity or not having access to the live stream or recordings. Also works well in different types of lighting. I will be buying more to add indoors.
customer_reviews.author: MisterReed

customer_reviews.title: Love it but needs a little tweeking to the design.
customer_reviews.text: Love the convenience. Easy to setup. Battery won’t last two years if the area you are watching is busy. I can’t plug in the camera outside because too far from the house and they only sell a 10’ cord. So three of my cameras will need to replace battery before the two years. a message appears on the iPhone telling me that those three cameras are using a lot of battery and will have to replace sooner. The holder is not very good for outdoors. It has to be drilled only into wood. Nothing offered for metal or concrete. Overall, so much fun to have. I can see all the animals roaming through the garden.
customer_reviews.author: golflover2001

customer_reviews.title: These are working as expected
customer_reviews.text: Originally, purchased the outdoor version of these cameras, but the order was cancelled by Amazon for lack of inventory. I found the indoor version at the same sale price of the outdoor version. The motion detection is terrible and just annoying. I deactivated it. Do like the option of checking in on the house via the very stable app. The video quality is far better then the cameras offered from our security company. I do recommend these cameras. The only slight negative is that these little cameras don't come at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Summerhouse

customer_reviews.title: Get insurance. Lots of cams have been malfunctioning after 2-3 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Did good, worked great, that is until the battery died and I swapped them out. My unit was not able to reconnect/sync with the module unit. Found out on a forum thatthere have been many customers with the same issue indicating that the camera is a malfunctioning unit that cannot be fixed. Now i just haveit sitting on the side unplugged with hopes that it'll just randomly work again. I even bought my dad a couple units before my issue to help him as an amputee monitor his home via mobile. I will monitor how his system works before final judgement. 4 cameras total. 1 for me, 3 for him. Mine went out 2 months after purchase through depleted batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Ecko Quest

customer_reviews.title: Durable and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: We have more than a few of these. Great indoor camera. If you want night vision get the outdoor version. The cameras have all been durable and reliable. Only disappointment with software - app- is that the only recording options are motion detection. So with interval recording things get missed in between. The outdoor versions are really durable, even in cat 3 hurricanes!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good indoor camera set
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent indoor camera system though I wish it had 1080p and night vision. Setup is super straightforward and comes with everything you need. One downside to the app is it doesn't allow multiple users to one camera network so you'll need to share your 1 login with others if you want others to be able to monitor
customer_reviews.author: dezymondTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Better quality & battery than the blink for outdoors
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this blink for the interior of our home and for the price it is decent. Pros: -good battery life(in comparison to the blink outdoor home security camera) -ideal for watching the kids&pets Cons: -does not actually have night vision,it is an illuminator. -does not have 2 way audio,meaning you cannot speak out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Not what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the features didn’t realize you couldn’t talk through this camera & the night time exposure flashes when subject enters room. Not what I hoped for. The outdoor/indoor camera has better features Wasted my money on trying to get the indoor version.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Afflerbach

customer_reviews.title: Dishonest Company - Touted SmartThings Integration, then abruptly Disabled
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY if you care about integration with the rest of your smart home. Blink was advertising for months that their product "works with SmartThings," and I imagine they sold quite a few systems based on that integration. They abruptly shutoff that integration without warning or explanation, effectively making my entire system useless. I will never buy a product from this company again. Look at Ring or Arlo instead.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - worked for a few months then started getting "live view failed" error
customer_reviews.text: While it was easy to setup and started working fine, within a few months the camera quit & i keep getting "live view failed" errors from my phone. Tried to power down the entire network, reconnect internet/wifi, power up the sync mod - same issue. Even brought the camera and set it right next to the sync mod & my wifi switch. Garbage - look up "live view failed" on blink forums - no solution - I am going to try & send this back although it's been over a month - what a piece of garbage!
customer_reviews.author: hogner

customer_reviews.title: Extremely simple to use and setup
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for an easy to use camera system with very simple setup then this is for you. Took me 45 minutes to setup a three camera system including mounting each camera. There is no wiring as it runs through WiFi and the cameras are battery powered with AA batteries. I installed them in a second home so I could monitor all of the doors. They last a surprisingly long time on one set of batteries. Mine are still running on the original batteries 8 months later. The motion detection is on point and there are no additional fees to store recordings. This couldn’t be any easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot so this camera gives me comfort while I am away by always knowing what's happening outside my door. Motion detection is great and the video quality. Very happy with the product for the price. My only 2 downsides are the battery only lasted 2 months and it did not give me a heads up when it was low. So while I was away from home it just died. Second downside is it freezes up every weeks or 2 weeks causing me to disarm it and re arm it so it stops sending me motion alerts when no one is there. Overall happy with my camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had I known this, I wouldn’t have purchased
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. As far as cameras they are ok but not as security system. When the camera is activated, a blue light on the camera lights up, guess you are letting someone know you’re watching. Second thing, night vision isn’t what you think, unlike other cameras I own, this one turns on a white light to light up the camera view instead of having true night vision. Had I know this or read that, I would not have purchased these!!!
customer_reviews.author: James Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Great security cameras system.
customer_reviews.text: I had the cameras for 3 nights now. I like them very much. The only thing I don't like it is that takes about 10-20 seconds to activate motion sensor. I might have to check the settings to see if I can change that. Customer service was really nice and patient with me when I called when I had difficulties during installation. Great people. I am planning to buy more cameras to add on. I added 3 more cameras.
customer_reviews.author: latina9294

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay.  Free cloud storage.
customer_reviews.text: For the price- it’s great. Especially the free cloud could pay for itself. But this isn’t suitable for an apartment. The sensitivity isn’t great for distance. My utility would be to catch a window and my front door but after arriving at 11pm and turning a light on- it only caught motion when I walked 5 feet away. For night vision- it is a bright white light. No avoiding that. When recording - a blue light turns on. I wish there were alternate logins- instead my partner and I share the same login. It’s a great one family camera- but it just wasn’t a good fit for me. I used it for 2 weeks before making this review.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! as long as you have a flash and some light it great. Night time vision not so great and also I wish that the app had a way to manipulate the video or picture in order to enlarge or zoom in to the captured items.
customer_reviews.author: lala

customer_reviews.title: Blink Indoor Home Security Camera, 1st Generation
customer_reviews.text: Love this home monitoring camera unit. Very easy install and set-up. The Blink software is a Work In Progress, but is simple to use as long as you don't need to download your recordings. The only disappointment with the 1st generation Blink Interior Cameras is their total lack of Two-Way audio. This is a simple feature which much cheaper camera units from Blink competitors have been able to offer. The fact that these Blink units offer one way audio makes the decision to omit a two-way audio solution in the Blink home security cameras even more baffling. In any case, I'm absolutely happy with my Blink camera system which incorporates both interior and exterior units.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: I have 6 myself, ordered these indoor for a gift
customer_reviews.text: I love love love blink cameras. I threw my ring cameras out when i got the blink system. there is no comparison between these and ring cameras. My cameras get used a lot and record a lot so the batteries only lasted about 6 months. but the same batteries are easy to get and dont cost a arm and a leg. I have talked about these so much I have talked several people into getting them. I got this indoor system for a gift for my mother to watch her dog while at work. they also work rather far from the router. I will buy more in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Shuts down automatically in middle of night
customer_reviews.text: This system automatically turns off and disables itself in middle of night with no notification. When I called technical support they said it was a defect in the software and no known fix any time soon. What good is a security camera that shuts down at night?
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Mounting bracket does not work at all.
customer_reviews.text: The camera works fine, but the mounting bracket does not work at all!!! There no instructions whatsoever on how to use the mounting bracket, and from what I can tell, the mounting bracket that was included is designed for a different camera (see attached photo). Am I supposed to just use duct tape to attach this camera to the wall?!?
customer_reviews.author: So Cal

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set-Up and Portable!
customer_reviews.text: I have ADT cameras for my home with 24 hour surveillance (hard-wired), but did not have a camera view of interior of my garage; only exterior as cars drive up to garage. I didn’t want the expense of adding another camera inside garage. So, I thought I would try Blink—since no additional fees and self-Install. Very pleased. Super easy to set-up and have good range view and quality video of parked cars and surrounding area in garage! Got it on promotional sale, so even better.
customer_reviews.author: Greenie

product_meta.title: Blink Indoor Home Security Camera System with Motion Detection, HD Video, 2-Year Battery Life and Cloud Storage Included - 1 Camera Kit
feature_bullets: MOTION DETECTOR: Built-in motion sensor alarm, when motion detector is triggered, WIFI cameras send an alert to your smartphone and record a short clip of the event to the cloud
BATTERY POWERED SECURITY SYSTEM: Wireless home camera with 2-year battery life, powered by 2 Lithium AA 1.5v non-rechargeable Lithium batteries (included), data is sent from IP cameras over Wi-Fi
SMART HOME SECURITY: Simple self-install home monitoring in minutes; easy control wireless cameras with the included iOS & Android apps or via voice through our Amazon Alexa Skill!
ADVANCED HOME SURVEILLANCE: Home and pet monitoring in real time with video camera “Live View” streaming mode
FREE CLOUD STORAGE: Totally wire-free, with no monthly fees or service contract required. (Requires iOS 10.3 or Android 5 Lollipop or higher)
WORKS WITH ALEXA – View live streams, motion clips, arm and disarm your system, and set up smart reorders for batteries through select Alexa-enabled devices.
